annonstext:
THIS IS US, YOUR NEW COLLEAGUES

We are a diverse legal team with one fantastic culture. You will be part of a global team of legal counsels providing support to the entire Volvo purchasing organization. Your future legal team colleagues are in Sweden, China, Germany, France and the United States.

 

ROLE DESCRIPTION

We are recruiting a Legal Counsel to the GTP Legal and Compliance Department. This role will support the purchase of components and services for the Volvo Group focusing on Information Technology (IT). You will report to the Senior Vice President, General Counsel, Legal & Compliance, Group Trucks Purchasing. The work tasks offer cross-functional collaboration with other Volvo legal counsels and business stakeholders across the globe and may require occasional travel.

Main Activities and Responsibilities:

	Participate in IT and data services sourcing projects
	Participate in contract drafting and negotiations
	Coordinate with legal counsels from other parts of the Volvo Group around the world
	Provide counsel to business stakeholders in conjunction with disputes
	Drafting and updating contract templates and legal guidelines
	Provide support on intellectual property matters (dependent on experience)
	Promote compliance with laws and regulations and internal legal processes
	Proactively manage and enhance awareness of legal and commercial risks

Critical Competencies:

	10+ years of automotive IT experience
	Bachelor of Law
	Excellent English communication skills, both verbal and written
	Proficiency in negotiation and drafting of contracts together with experience in contract and commercial law in the IT, data, SaaS/PaaS space
	A true business interest and understanding of the IT market, with high drive and energy
	Readiness to perform multiple duties effectively in a fast-paced environment
	A drive to learn, develop and contribute to the success of the Volvo Group and the legal team
	Creative problem-solving abilities and a commercial interest
	Curious, accountable and proactive with a “can do” mindset
	Ability to work independently and in teams
	Ability to work cross jurisdictions with cultural awareness and appreciation
	Strong personal credibility and integrity

Advantages:

	Knowledge of Swedish law
	Experience with Intellectual Property
	Technical background
	Prior experience working with a multi-national organization

If you think you’re a match, please send your resume and motivational letter in English for consideration.

Location: Flexible, Sweden preferred

Employment/Assignment Type: Permanent

Travel Required (maximum): Occasional

For more information please contact:

Michael Atella, SVP, Legal and Compliance,  TELEPHONENO 6
